intro: Cleistanthus langkawiensis, commonly known as the Langkawi cleistanthus, is a rare tropical tree native to the island of Langkawi in Malaysia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native region.
